about_the_game:
Welcome Back General, Expand & Exterminate: Terrytorial Disputes is a procedurally generated base defense game with strong real-time strategy (RTS) influences. In this game, you must defend your base against waves of enemy forces while also expanding your territory and gathering resources. You'll have access to a variety of towers and technologies to help you in your fight, and you'll need to carefully strategize and adapt to each new challenge as the game procedurally generates new enemy waves and environments. With its immersive gameplay, challenging enemies, and deep progression system, Expand & Exterminate: Terrytorial Disputes will keep you on the edge of your seat as you strive for victory.


Expand
In Terrytorial Disputes, terrain expansion plays a crucial role in your overall strategy. As you progress through the game, you'll have the opportunity to expand your base’s footprint by generating additional chunks of the map. This not only helps you to gather more resources and generate income, but it also allows you expand your base with additional towers and structures to better protect your territory. The procedurally generated environments of Terrytorial Disputes add an extra layer of challenge and depth to the gameplay, as you'll need to adapt your expansion strategy to the unique terrains and layout.

Exterminate
In Expand & Exterminate: Terrytorial Disputes, you'll face a variety of enemy forces as you progress through the game. Each wave of enemies is procedurally generated, meaning that the game creates unique enemy compositions and behaviors each time you play. This keeps the gameplay fresh and challenging, as you'll never know exactly what to expect from each new enemy wave.

The enemy forces you'll face include both land and air units, and you'll need to build and upgrade your towers accordingly to defend against these threats. Some enemies may be weaker and easier to take down, while others may be more formidable and require more firepower to defeat. You'll also encounter bosses and elite units, which are stronger and more challenging than regular enemies. As you progress through the game, you'll need to adapt your strategy and defenses to the specific strengths and weaknesses of each enemy type.

Unlike other Tower Defense games, the enemies fight back. Don’t forget to construct walls to protect your vital resource structures.
Research
The tech tree in Terrytorial Disputes is a massive and deep progression system that allows you to unlock over 250 unique technologies & over 75 structures and tower. These technologies include a wide range of upgrades and enhancements for your turrets, structures, and other buildings, as well abilities that you can use in battle.

As you earn EXP through gameplay, you'll be able to visit the Tech Shop and spend your points on new technologies to unlock. These techs are grouped into various categories and tiers, with higher-tier techs requiring more EXP to unlock. Some of the techs you can unlock include turret stat buffs that increase the damage or range of your towers, damage upgrades that make your units and structures more powerful, and structures that boost the stats of other buildings.

The tech tree in Terrytorial Disputes is an important aspect of the game, as it allows you to tailor your defenses and strategy to your playstyle and the specific challenges you face. With so many different technologies to unlock, there are endless possibilities for customization and optimization as you battle to survive and emerge victorious.

Intent
I find that most Tower Defense games have this sweet spot, the peak of the game where the dopamine is flowing most, is at that intersection where you're constantly having to build up while also fighting a real challenge.

name: Expand & Exterminate: Terrytorial Disputes Demo
short_description: Defend your base in this unique blend of Tower Defense and RTS. Expand your base, build and upgrade towers, gather resources, and unlock over 250 technologies as you exterminate enemy forces. Revisit the nostalgia of the Late 90's/Early 2000's Golden Age of RTS games.
